questions.question1Part1.1: What kind of music do you like to listen to?

questions.question2Part1.1: What is your favorite meal of the day?

questions.question3Part1.1: Can you describe a place you like to visit often?

questions.question1Part1.2: How do these two places make you feel, and which one would you prefer for studying?

questions.question2Part1.2: What are the people in each picture doing, and how are their activities different from each other?

questions.question3Part1.2: What advantages might there be to studying in a place like the one shown in the second picture?

questions.question1Part2: What benefits do you think these people get from spending time outdoors in nature?
How do you think this experience might be different from doing indoor activities?
Do you think people should spend more time in nature? Why or why not?

questions.statement: Children should not be given smartphones until they are teenagers.

For.fact1: Helps them focus on studies without distractions
For.fact3: Reduces risks of excessive screen time and online dangers

Against.fact1: Smartphones help children learn and access educational content
Against.fact2: They provide a way for parents to communicate with their children
Against.fact3: Allowing smartphones at a younger age can help children learn digital skills early
